title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3 ยง 6.2 - Competing applications
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3 ยง 6.2 - Competing applications

State Regulations
(a) If applications are filed by two or more
institutions for new branches in the same area and, in the judgment of the
superintendent, approval of only one branch is warranted, particular
consideration will be given to the following factors: (1)
which of the institutions is best able, in terms of capital and management strength, to support an additional
office; (2)
the effects of approval
on competition and public choice among banking institutions in the
area; (3)
the effects of approval
on the competitive banking structure on a citywide or countywide
basis; (4)
the performance of the
institution pursuant to the standards set forth in General Regulation Part 76; and
(5)
any other factors which may
be of particular relevance in a given situation. (b) In no event will the date of filing of
the application be the sole factor in deciding which of the competing branch
applications is approved. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3
ยง
6.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
